number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 24, 2014
												Eh, TL:DR? It's kinda long. :c This game has everything you may have already heard about. On the other hand, it also has a few things that it's praised for bringing to the table, but sadly, this game is nothing more than a game which had potential that failed to be pushed forth to something truly "legendary".  Allow me to go over the positives, because this game isn't exactly "terrible". For one thing, the theme of the game is quite intriguing. I mean, come on, who wouldn't want to blast minotaurs with machine guns while griffons are flying overhead trying to combat large helicopters and gunships? Let me tell ya: nobody. This idea may not be "fresh" but it's definitely alluring and fun to try out for just a few bucks. The game sets you right in motion as soon as it begins. You play as a hired thief named Deckard who is assigned to steal the grand Pandoras Box. Upon activating it, however, your body is infused with the power associated with the box and creatures begin pouring out of the box's openings. Before you know it, the entirety of New York is infested with mythological creatures like griffons, werewolves, golems, and so on. Now, allow me to name the main positive factor of this game, the atmosphere and interactions made between the creatures and NPCs or cooperative AI is actually rather fascinating. You'll find yourself stuck in situations where you'll need to fend off against groups of different creatures but luckily with the hand of some helpful army guys. There are soooo many cool ways things can go from good to bad for you and your team, and although the game itself is pretty simplistic, it's pretty cool watching your AI buddies fending off the best they can.   The atmosphere also has nothing to hide. The scenery is gorgeous, but never fully sustained. The opening areas feel repetitious and so does most of the other factors of the game. Once again, this is why this game had a lot of potential. The areas that this game presents strongly and without flaws deem this game something worthwhile, but unfortunately many of the minor details of this game just force it to fall short. Allow me to venture into the negatives now.  Okay, so there's quite a number of things about this game which sour the experience and ultimately weaken the game's value. These flaws are numerous yet tolerable which is why I assume many people thought this was an enjoyable game. The flaws spread around the repetitive feel of this game. This game has a low variety of weaponry and beasties to fight. There are very few soundtracks in this game and sadly, the fighting experience is very unsatisfying. Fighting werewolves is perhaps the most satisfying feel to this game because in order to kill it you need to land a headshot which feels great to deliver, but it's not too challenging since the werewolf becomes immobile upon taking too many shots. So, all you literally need to do is walk up to it, shoot it in the head, and yay-you killed it. Rinse and repeat. Again. And again. And again. Oh! Maybe with a different gun! Rinse and repeat.  There's only about four or five weapons in the game with less than ten monsters to fight. Now, yes, I understand that the game is short, but you feel the drag occur vividly. About half of the monsters (especially the griffon and minotaurs) feel spongy and only reward you with what you lost while trying to fight them. You see, when you kill monsters in the game, you're given Animus energy. This is the power which you're given upon activating Pandoras' Box in the beginning of the game. You can use Animus energy to either repel monsters or heal yourself. Now, repelling enemies takes a lot of Animus and doesn't harm them, it just pushes them away. So I can already guarantee you'll only be healing yourself with Animus more than anything. So, ask yourself. WHY WOULD I FIGHT MONSTERS, HEAL THE DAMAGE I TOOK, THEN TAKE THEIR ENERGY JUST TO REPEAT THE SAME PROCEDURE?  What? You think there's more to the game? NOPE. There is NOTHING ELSE. Shoot. Heal. Steal Animus. Rinse. Then ♥♥♥♥ing repeat. *takes a deep breath* Okay, I'd like to also note that it gets worse. Since only the creatures reward you with Animus, human enemies do not. And, sadly, human opponents are probably more infuriating to deal with. They deal a lot of damage, work well in groups, and have access to throwables. So you're probably wondering: "Well how do I heal, especially if I reach a checkpoint?" Heh. Get to cover and conserve your Animus wisely, bud. That's your only option. There are no medkits, no salves, no bandages, no nothin'. You're gonna have to tough it out.   Oh, and now I'd like to mention the throwables. You're only given two throwables in the game: molotovs and grenades. Molotovs cover a very small radius and last maybe two or three seconds. Grenades are more useful but since you'll mainly be using them against human opponents, they're practically useless. Molotovs should only be used against blood spiders which aren't introduced until you get halfway through the game...  Hmm... I feel as though I've covered many of the negatives, but I could ramble all day. I apologize for jumping all over the place in this review guys but honestly, I just hate the fact that I can't enjoy this game, This was a title which I had a lot of faith in. Despite the droning music, bullet-absorbing masses of baddies, frustrating AI, boring plot, and every other little piece of crap smudged together, there might be some type of gem hidden beneath the rubble. Do I think it's worth the few bucks? Sure. Just don't expect a miracle.

												So i buyed it a year ago and just played it for 20 minutes then, but yesterday i started the game again and today i just finished it.The game took about 6 hours to me and i think it would have a total of 8 hours if you search for every email.It's just a normal linear-FPS, but i actually liked the Story (i don't gonna spoil now).For a 2008 game the graphics is alright, but i`ve laughed at the animations (The walking-animation of Vivian? My god, i laughed so hard on this) and for sure the mouse speed, that was hella to fast for me, the option was on 0 and it was even to fast, but hey, i like slow mouses ;)I actually encounterd a glitch near the end, you get into an elevator, vivian speaks to you and the elevator starts and then you fall down.Sloution? On windows 7 go to library->documents->my games->Legendary->PandoraGame->ConfigOpen the .txt File called PandoraEngine and search for MaxSmoothedFrameRate=300 and change 300 to 60 or 30. If it doesn't work try to change bSmoothFrameRate=TRUE to FALSE, hope it helps you :)So at all it's a good game for some hours and for 2.99€ or now with sale on .74 pens, you should buy and play it :)

content:
Posted: December 13, 2014
												Ok, I figured "<$1, gotta be worth something, right?" Well, if I had tried it 10 years ago I might have been satisfied with this purchase. The thing is, the game came out in 2008. I personally didn't finish the game, and more than likely won't ever do so, especially since my library is already backlogged so heavily, so please take all of this with a grain of salt. Anyway, let me explain the issues:-Graphics are barely passable as an early Xbox 360 game, even at the maximum settings-Animations are laughably bad, both on the human and creature models-The environments have little to no way of telling you what to do next or where to go. Granted, it usually can be figured out pretty quickly since the player can only jump a maximum of 5 cm, usually only leaving one possible path.-Werewolves have a cool mechanic where you have to decapitate them to kill them otherwise they regenerate. Wish the same could be said for other enemies. The developer must have realized this too, and decided to make the werewolf the enemy you face (besides other humans, who also for some reason want to kill you for opening the box) at least 90% of the time-Subways and indoor areas were entirely overused, which is a shame, as the opening outdoor sequence was pretty cool, even though it didn't wow in the graphics department.-Why is literally everyone covered in blood?! Seriously, damn near every character in the opening sequence is covered head to toe in blood. A nitpick, but it bugged me.-Physics based objects, when they do appear, are super wonky. This also extends to the ragdoll effects.-Controls arent terrible, but definitely could have been much more refined. The aim down sights could probably have been excluded and I wouldn't have complained in the slightest.-Voice acting is wooden, the story is not the slightest bit coherent, other than the main concept introduced in the first few minutesPros:-Cool opening city destruction scene-Liked the general look of some enemies-The concept was what actually pushed me to buy the game. You open Pandora's Box, a bunch of scary monsters and♥♥♥♥♥♥come out and wreck everything and you gotta go kill em all and save the city.Remember, I did not finish the game, so don't completely disregard this if it is in fact on sale. Hoever, as I pointed out in my review, the game suffers more than just a bad story and bad visuals. It was simply not fun to play.3/10 regret purchasing

content:
Posted: July 10, 2014
												If it's on sale- I bought it for $0.74- definitely worth the price. I wouldn't spring more than maybe $2 or $3 for it though. It's fun enough to hold your attention, and it's different enough to be intriguing. Worth a few hours of your time, and if you don't like it, you're only out a buck.PROSIntriguing story.Just enough interactive elements to make it somewhat immersive.A different take on combat than you sometimes see. For example, some beasties you might have to injure in a very specific way in combat or after they are felled to win. It's different, and you'll have to think on what you know of mythology to really get it, which makes the plot that much more immersive.  Some of the environment is destructable and has to be destroyed to logically solve a puzzle to get to the next stage.CONSSomewhat on rails as you're essentially guided from one area to another by the environment. The intrigue is taken away if you read the notes on the creatures and such as they're somewhat spoilerific. Although much of the environment is interactive or destructable, enough of it isn't that it's easy to forget to try to puzzle through it as if it were a real-life or Dungeons and Dragons type game.

content:
Posted: July 19, 2014
												I had a great time with this game, i walked into it expecting problems due to the reviews but i never once encountered a noticable glitch or failure, there is one thing that i hated the most about this game, the jumping you jump like an inch, and it feels like there shouldn't even be jumping, but if you want to go 30 mph just get to a ledge and sprint jump off, you'll go flying. This game has alot of cool moments, but at other times it feels a tad bit boring. Especially at the end, there isn't any feeling of urgency during the final level. I only died once, and it was because one of the monsters in this game, the minotaur, is a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥ He will constantly follow you, running at your pace unless your sprinting, he flawless tails you even when charging, he runs through the walls in the arenas, that they put you in to fight him, flawlessly, it's like he can walk through the damn things. The game tells you to shoot him in the back, and that is super difficult because he rarely charges and when he does, it's hard to dodge. Every other enemy though is easy to fight. This game will turn into a puzzle game easily, there will be times where you have no idea what to do, and the solution is so obvious you don't notice it. The weapon switch is super slow. When you try to heal yourself with the "aminus" juice you have, it takes a little longer than it should, and is hard to control. God help you if you're trying to pick up a weapon while running if you're being chased, it's a huge thing that would've helped me during a lot of battles. On the good side the cutscenes, soundtrack, atmosphere is amazing, the AI is ok, i've seen them do some stupid♥♥♥♥♥♥though. Overall for five dollars i think this is a steal, if you like games with good graphics that run well even on the highest settings with bad pc parts, this is your game, my ram runs at like 500 mhz, and i ran it on highest settings.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 24, 2014
												I know the second you saw this you were confused. Legendary a good game?!?!? But I am being serious here. I loved this game. Everyone says either "It is pretty moderate for a shooter" or "Bad game"  which I don't understand at all. I had more fun with this shooter than COD! In COD you fight a bunch of similair stupid♥♥♥♥♥enemies who have no special abilities at all. Or you play an average zombie survival mode. Or you play online agains't a bunch of screaming kids and swearing adults with absolutely no innovation at all even in the sequels it is almost exactly the same. What happens in Legendary? Griffins swoop down picking up enemies in their mouths and eating them. Werewolfs lunge at you and throw objects at you and when they are killed you have to chop of their heads or they recuperate. Fire drakes shoot fire out of their mouths at you but can be taken care of by activating a sprinkler or shooting a fire extinguisher. And while you are doing this a MASSIVE golem above is smashing through buildings and stepping on fleeing people. Also a giant tentacled beast is grabbing allies and pulling them to a watery grave. And guess what. Those tentacles can also grab you and the golem can also step on you. All these mythical creatures from different cultures are trying to kill you while you are trying to destroy a golem by activating 3 EMPs to seperate the energy of the golem from the body. Explosive spiders from Japan, Fire Drakes from old tales and a Kraken from common folklore. My favourite creature is the Nari. A creepy bat like creature with a childs face who can become a ghost and              a physical creature. They often possess objects and throw them at you and generally make life a pain. They steal objects needed for objectives and force you to chase them down often leading you to traps. One time a Nari stole a valve I needed to proceed and dropped it in a suspicious looking chamber. When I entered the doors closed and a fan possessed by the Nari  started sucking me towards it. Only by shooting the supports could I barely escape and when I did I was attacked by a tentacle and almost pulled towards my doom. And that is only level 2. The only bad thing I would say about this game is the graphics however because of the graphics it works on less powerful computers like mine. Some of the most popular games also have bad graphics like HL2 and Killing Floor but noone complains about that. All in all I would give it an 8/10. Definitely worth playing and fun.

												Totally worth the $0.94 that I paid for it. It's linear FPS mayhem with a lil' bit of magic. Storyline is decent, but the game was told and wrapped up well. Controls are tight, but jumping up/down is cosmetic, however you can sprint-jump gaps. I wish the campaign was a little longer and that there were more big bosses. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 2, 2014
												Mechanically, Legendary is pretty average in every way I can think of. But it has some neat ideas that make it worth a play. The game has surprisingly nice visuals with a lot of detail in some areas and I'll be damned if the ruined cities didn't look cool. I think they wanted to go with a bit of a horror atmosphere in the game but really its just depressing. There are mutilated dead people ♥♥♥♥ing everywhere and just about everyone you meet dies 15 seconds later in some horrible, gruesome way. Human enemies are a chore to fight but luckily the monsters are the stars here. Werewolves are pretty fun and I personally loved blowing their heads off with the shotgun and deagle. Also apparently the MC Dekard used to be the world's best firefighter because he swings that axe like a damn pro. Pixies are gay ♥♥♥♥s and I hate them. Fire lizards are kind of annoying but I like that water can kill them. Deagle, LMG, and shotgun are all fun but the rest of the weapons are pretty forgetable. The game is short mostly because you can run like Sanic (but for some reason only jump like 5 inches) but it's probably for the best because I feel like if it was any longer it would start to drag. I actually enjoyed the soundtrack a lot, especially the main menu theme. Overall its a pretty fun game as long as you don't go into expecting much. Would buy for $1 again. 6/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 24, 2014
												Eh, TL:DR? It's kinda long. :c This game has everything you may have already heard about. On the other hand, it also has a few things that it's praised for bringing to the table, but sadly, this game is nothing more than a game which had potential that failed to be pushed forth to something truly "legendary".  Allow me to go over the positives, because this game isn't exactly "terrible". For one thing, the theme of the game is quite intriguing. I mean, come on, who wouldn't want to blast minotaurs with machine guns while griffons are flying overhead trying to combat large helicopters and gunships? Let me tell ya: nobody. This idea may not be "fresh" but it's definitely alluring and fun to try out for just a few bucks. The game sets you right in motion as soon as it begins. You play as a hired thief named Deckard who is assigned to steal the grand Pandoras Box. Upon activating it, however, your body is infused with the power associated with the box and creatures begin pouring out of the box's openings. Before you know it, the entirety of New York is infested with mythological creatures like griffons, werewolves, golems, and so on. Now, allow me to name the main positive factor of this game, the atmosphere and interactions made between the creatures and NPCs or cooperative AI is actually rather fascinating. You'll find yourself stuck in situations where you'll need to fend off against groups of different creatures but luckily with the hand of some helpful army guys. There are soooo many cool ways things can go from good to bad for you and your team, and although the game itself is pretty simplistic, it's pretty cool watching your AI buddies fending off the best they can.   The atmosphere also has nothing to hide. The scenery is gorgeous, but never fully sustained. The opening areas feel repetitious and so does most of the other factors of the game. Once again, this is why this game had a lot of potential. The areas that this game presents strongly and without flaws deem this game something worthwhile, but unfortunately many of the minor details of this game just force it to fall short. Allow me to venture into the negatives now.  Okay, so there's quite a number of things about this game which sour the experience and ultimately weaken the game's value. These flaws are numerous yet tolerable which is why I assume many people thought this was an enjoyable game. The flaws spread around the repetitive feel of this game. This game has a low variety of weaponry and beasties to fight. There are very few soundtracks in this game and sadly, the fighting experience is very unsatisfying. Fighting werewolves is perhaps the most satisfying feel to this game because in order to kill it you need to land a headshot which feels great to deliver, but it's not too challenging since the werewolf becomes immobile upon taking too many shots. So, all you literally need to do is walk up to it, shoot it in the head, and yay-you killed it. Rinse and repeat. Again. And again. And again. Oh! Maybe with a different gun! Rinse and repeat.  There's only about four or five weapons in the game with less than ten monsters to fight. Now, yes, I understand that the game is short, but you feel the drag occur vividly. About half of the monsters (especially the griffon and minotaurs) feel spongy and only reward you with what you lost while trying to fight them. You see, when you kill monsters in the game, you're given Animus energy. This is the power which you're given upon activating Pandoras' Box in the beginning of the game. You can use Animus energy to either repel monsters or heal yourself. Now, repelling enemies takes a lot of Animus and doesn't harm them, it just pushes them away. So I can already guarantee you'll only be healing yourself with Animus more than anything. So, ask yourself. WHY WOULD I FIGHT MONSTERS, HEAL THE DAMAGE I TOOK, THEN TAKE THEIR ENERGY JUST TO REPEAT THE SAME PROCEDURE?  What? You think there's more to the game? NOPE. There is NOTHING ELSE. Shoot. Heal. Steal Animus. Rinse. Then ♥♥♥♥ing repeat. *takes a deep breath* Okay, I'd like to also note that it gets worse. Since only the creatures reward you with Animus, human enemies do not. And, sadly, human opponents are probably more infuriating to deal with. They deal a lot of damage, work well in groups, and have access to throwables. So you're probably wondering: "Well how do I heal, especially if I reach a checkpoint?" Heh. Get to cover and conserve your Animus wisely, bud. That's your only option. There are no medkits, no salves, no bandages, no nothin'. You're gonna have to tough it out.   Oh, and now I'd like to mention the throwables. You're only given two throwables in the game: molotovs and grenades. Molotovs cover a very small radius and last maybe two or three seconds. Grenades are more useful but since you'll mainly be using them against human opponents, they're practically useless. Molotovs should only be used against blood spiders which aren't introduced until you get halfway through the game...  Hmm... I feel as though I've covered many of the negatives, but I could ramble all day. I apologize for jumping all over the place in this review guys but honestly, I just hate the fact that I can't enjoy this game, This was a title which I had a lot of faith in. Despite the droning music, bullet-absorbing masses of baddies, frustrating AI, boring plot, and every other little piece of crap smudged together, there might be some type of gem hidden beneath the rubble. Do I think it's worth the few bucks? Sure. Just don't expect a miracle.

content:
Posted: June 17, 2015
												6/10 GOOD GAME BUT EASILY FORGETTABLE Legendary was released in 2008 during a time where the FPS genre was ran by the likes of call of duty,bioshock.halo,fear,red faction and games of the like so naturally the gameplay isnt too far offfrom those. it lacks variety and depth both in story and gameplay but on the flip side the visuals and frame rate are pretty amazing for their time. the game had clunky irresponisve controls which didnt make a big difference alot of the time but there were times (like during the minotar and griffin fights)were snappier controls would have been helpful but werent there so movements and actions had to be pre planned and not done on the fly. overall this game is definitly worth a playthough with a few things in mind:- dont take it too seriously - dont try and compare it to modern games- put it on easy,kick your feet up and enjoy the games nice visuals and loose story.

content:
Posted: March 7, 2015
												I did see this game at the GC (similar to E3) several years ago and thought: "Well, this one looks quite nice".Several years later, I picked up the game despite the bad reviews and really don't like what I got for my money.The game might still be quite nice for you, if you are not affected by the following problems:- it is heavily scripted, to the point that you will have to wait for up to 30 seconds before you can proceed along the narrow path that was designed for the player. If your are ahead of the game's script (which seems to be happening on a regular basis for me) you will find your path blocked by debris, cars, you name it - which will magically dissolve in an animation a few moments later- the scripted enemies / people have got neither AI nor any kind of clipping, making them completely oblivious to your existence- the game runs smoothly on my convertible (i5 3317u and HD 4000) but does glitch quite a lot (textures are missing, people look shiny, ...)- the AI seems pretty terrible within the first 30 minutes (those fire demons started rolling around in circles)Therefore, I can't recommend this game ;)

												Super poorly executed game that could have been great. Story is horribly written. Feels like they started making the game and around map three decided to just give up and rush it to gold. Story line begins as you, for no reason at all, open pandoras box and all hell breaks loose only for you to have to go a fix the damage you caused (for no reason at all). Don't expect much variety here. The first few levels are impressive, but that's about it -- level design begins to get stale and feel more like a rehash. You'll be fighting the same monsters you encounter in the first three maps through the whole game and the boss fights are few and far inbetween. Poor gameplay causes distress in many situations. I can't recommend it. I actually finished the game on account that I had the "idea" that it could get better, but it didn't.

												The game had alot of problems to deal with throughout the entire campaign. The bugs that I encountered made the game maddening in some areas of the game. The graphics were old school and didn't look like there was much thought into it. This was a basic shooter with flaws. The story was nothing amazing as it is about stopping the bad guy from destroying the world. The end of the game kept you wanting more and left stuff open. The multiplayer is dead. The game felt very repetitive and nothing new. The nymphs and werewolves are the most of your worries in this game. The puzzles are simple. The game took me 2 hours to beat. Its a good game to replace a movie but don't pick this game up unless its at a discounted price. It was a "meh" game. Nothing really impressive, the meta scores that came with this game are accurate. If you want it get it, but if your interested in it and want a new adventure then this is one to pass.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 4, 2013
												I was pleasantly suprised by Legendary. I wasn't expecting much at all, but it was fun.  Now the game could've used some more polish. Fighting the Judge Dredds wasn't all that good, but still ok. Aiming with rifles was less than accurate. The atmosphere of the game was really good. It's the kind of game that demands to be played late at night with the lights out and headphones on. There's lots of crazy chaos with monsters terrorizing the planet. Traversing dark sewers always looking around for the creepy flying demons that giggle like little children and the sea creatures trying to pull you in with their tentacles was one of my favorite parts. There's a decent variety of supernatural monsters to fight and locations in the game. There are significant portions of the game where I felt just fine using only an axe. Chopping off were-wolf heads so they don't come back to life never got tiring. The game took around 6 hours to finish. The regular price is $5 and you simply can't go wrong for that price. It's not the greatest game ever, but I definitely recommend Legendary. It's good times.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 28, 2015
												*This review is solely on the single player campaign. I have not and do not plan on trying out the multiplayer component.*Legendary, an epic tale of opening Pandora's Box, and all the events that transpire. Beasts of mythological origin are unleashed upon the world when, you, a professional thief by the name of Deckard, open the box. You find yourself now scarred with an insignia of unusual power, and your employer, LeFey, the leader of a private organization, suddenly turns on you and leaves you to the wolves (quite literally) as he nabs Pandora's Box to take over all the mythic beasts. Thus, you are forced to having to work with The Council - a government agency bent on stopping LeFey and his Black Order organization at all costs, with an even greater idea brought to you at the end of the game. It's a very interesting concept, with great aims and claims.There are things to like.The beasts? The sprites, werewolves, griffins, and the gigantic creatures that can utterly destroy you and leave you stamping on your mouse and keyboard in fury? They feel very much alive. You know they've been stowed away for millenia, and they're hungry for blood, yours included. And they are merciless.Whoever did the soundtrack knew what to put in a shooter like this one. It's not going to make the top ten gaming soundtracks of all time, but it's more than sufficient to keep your head bopping while you're trying to kill a squad of Black Order members while trying to keep tentacles snaking out of the murky water from grabbing you. (No, this isn't hentai.) The same thing applies to many of the sound effects - despite the oomph not being present in the delivery of a weapon, there's still some partial satisfaction when you hear that shotgun blast, and feel it when a minotaur roars right before slamming you into the wall.The destruction. You know that you are no longer in a world ruled by man; the creatures from ancient folktales have taken over, and most of humanity is left either dead or hopeless, waiting for their time to come. Major landmarks are destroyed in front of your eyes - and while these spectacles aren't necessarily awe-inspiring to see, they still tug at you a little bit when you realize what just happened. The landscapes, as linear as they often are, can still leave you pausing for a moment to take in the devastation of what once was a busy city.Unfortunately, the title falls short in almost all other aspects.This game is incredibly linear - the only time you get a secondary path is to a collectible, and even that is pretty apparent.The graphics, even for its time, are nothing amazing; graphics nuts will be sorely disappointed by this game, even though the color palette and overrall appearance for everything is diverse for most of the game.Gunplay and many of the mechanics often feel lackluster; it can be felt that they were trying to go for something that felt solid and worked well, but they just don't mesh. Feeling frustrated because something you did didn't have the satisfactory result you keep expecting is a fairly common theme here. And despite you having supernatural powers, they're (well, rather, it) is pretty meh. Even the weakest enemies can feel more like a chore to fight, rather than a thrilling engagement.And this game is FAR from bug-free; I've run into several places where I've had to restart from a checkpoint because I either got stuck or broke the game in a way I wasn't expecting, and pretty much everyone who has played this game through can tell you about the elevator of death near the end of the game, and how it falls hard from there.And don't get me started on the story and the characters. There are more plotholes than plot points... and as far as the characters are concerned? The voice acting is flat and boring; expressions are next to nonexistent; character development is next to nothing - these characters have no life, nothing to empathize with. Plus, this game is short. The 5.5 hours I have at the time of writing this review? I beat the game in that time span. (Of course, some might view this as a plus, considering that it doesn't wear out its likely already unwelcome presence.) There's plenty more that I can go on about, but there are other reviews. Point is, I can imagine a lot of people who bought this game full price were sorely disappointed at this very unfinished project they received. And by the way - remember that fabulous idea I told you about that shows up at the end of the game? It's a layout for the sequel to this game. Which of course will never be realized after the terrible reception this game got.This game does have a certain charm, but it's nowhere near on par with other buggy messes like Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines or the S.T.A.L.K.E.R. series, which were broken in many ways but still provided a thoroughly enjoyable gaming experience.The gameplay is mediocre, the ending is terrible (no, seriously, I almost feel like they put the elevator bug in intentionally so you wouldn't see what they threw together and then realize that they had an even greater concept steaming, except that it wasn't in this game), and the game's tutorial opening sequence is a serious drag.In summation, this game is a brilliant concept that was poorly orchestrated. The core concept fades through just a bit, but it's hardly worth the slogging through the gameplay that is just irksome.

												Not bad since I purchased it for $2.00.  I was amazed by this game and disappointed.Early in the game, the production and atmosphere sets it up to be an awesome FPS in a horror type situation.However about 1/3rd in to this 5 hour game, it turned into subway/sewer tunnell runner FPS with very little that is interesting with regards to gameplay.You can tell the makers wanted to make a great game and had some good ideas, but it appears it was rushed and they were on a budget. Also the game is either too easy in some areas or too hard.  Many better games out there, but if you want to watch the world fall apart ~ this isn't that bad.

												Firstly, there's a bug on the final level requiring you to rewrite the ingame code limiting your max FPS to 30, just to get to the final boss.Secondly, everything is pregenerated, and not completely random i.e. spawns, certain interactions and checkpointed events.Mechanicly speaking, it's a decent game, but not worth the full price. All around one time play through value and that's it.

												Ok, here's my review of the game:GraphicsThe graphics are not fantastic, but they are good on my opinion. I love the London setting, they got a really good palette. The mythic creatures are great too, I wish there was some gorgons (Medusa) around.9SoundThe sound is alright for most part, but the sound track is a bit cheap, like 3 musics? number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 14, 2013
												This was an interesting game. It starts out relatively bland and as far as shooting mechanics go it remains highly mediocre. But the concept is good, the artwork is interesting and there are moments where you really see the designers put in some creativity (artwork, enemy types). Some areas are creepy and weird, others get very action-esque.Pros:- Good concept- Passable story- Good voice acting- Good environments- Good artwork and enemies- Great physics (one of the best uses of NVIDIA PhysX without hardware acceleration)Cons:- Shooting mechanics are very mediocre- Bugs and issues (infamous elevator bug near the endgame)- Can get very very hard at times- Control issues with KB+M (certain keys cannot be binded)- Can get repetitive and frustrating- Bad graphics. Almost no dynamic lighting. Shader effects are minimal, and it seems like they just used a stock UE3 and used whatever it provided. It's clear they put most of their effort in the non-human enemies and the physics.I certainly enjoyed this game, but it is to be noted that this game is best played in short bursts. For $4.99 on steam, you can't go wrong. Personal score: 7/10.

												This game has glimmers of greatness, but falls far short.The core gameplay is highly unsatisfying and simplified. The graphics are decent enough, with well designed visual set-pieces and vistas. The soundscape is always very full and vibrant, it never feels silent or empty.The story could have been very interesting, but the game's ending cuts everything short for a DLC or a sequel that will never arrive.All in all, a decent, if short, game if you can get it for a steep discount.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 25, 2013
												Not as bad as the reviews say. I went into it expecting a pretty terrible shooter with uninspired gameplay and a forgettable story.It's a fairly straightforward shooter with some annoying bits and poor difficulty tuning. However, the shooter elements are pretty good, and while the game tries a bit too hard on the horror-like elements, it does a good job of making the various monsters pretty intimidating.The actual story started out semi-decent, then evolved rapidly into something really stupid, then ended pretty well. It's not something to write home about but the ending was nice.Overall it's not bad even if it is kinda short (5-6 hours). Worth a look if it's on sale and you want to waste a few hours having fun shooting mythological creatures. I advise avoiding the hard difficulty setting, and even turning it down to easy if the challenges get annoying. The difficulty is poorly tuned and it is a bit more fun on easy than it is on other difficulty settings.

												Legendary. The game that *tried* to look like it was going to be open world.This game was a complete disgrace and I wish I never dropped 2 bucks on this crap. The tutoial, understandingly linear even felt like it was acting like a open world game.With the 19 (really about 12 minutes) I played of this game felt like hours. I got out of the tutorial; only for more open world (not really; but we made it look like it), it plays a cutscene. And another cutscene.Anyway; outside of it's not open world gameplay, You get meteoker voice acting, Bad writing, Linear as hell gameplay, Bad levels, etc. Just,  Not fun.  The story goes you are in some museum, you put your hand in "Pandora's box", and OH HEY THIS THING IS MAGIC. Now you have magic powers as the museum begins collapsing and various myths start popping out (You know; this could EASILY become a ghostbusters game at this point) and you have to run to the metro then in which case you have to make this jump (that you have to figure out how to cross yourself) THEN keep running to the metro while miracoulously NOT being murdered by these things while cars are being flung at various people closing   and all open world opprotunities [/b]  for that level. Then; you get into the metro and the SAME CRAP HAPPENS. At which point I decided to stop playing.Had the game captured me better I would feel good about playing the rest.The final rating for this game as I see it is about a 20/10. It has a great idea for a game; but horribly made.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 24, 2014
												Eh, TL:DR? It's kinda long. :c This game has everything you may have already heard about. On the other hand, it also has a few things that it's praised for bringing to the table, but sadly, this game is nothing more than a game which had potential that failed to be pushed forth to something truly "legendary".  Allow me to go over the positives, because this game isn't exactly "terrible". For one thing, the theme of the game is quite intriguing. I mean, come on, who wouldn't want to blast minotaurs with machine guns while griffons are flying overhead trying to combat large helicopters and gunships? Let me tell ya: nobody. This idea may not be "fresh" but it's definitely alluring and fun to try out for just a few bucks. The game sets you right in motion as soon as it begins. You play as a hired thief named Deckard who is assigned to steal the grand Pandoras Box. Upon activating it, however, your body is infused with the power associated with the box and creatures begin pouring out of the box's openings. Before you know it, the entirety of New York is infested with mythological creatures like griffons, werewolves, golems, and so on. Now, allow me to name the main positive factor of this game, the atmosphere and interactions made between the creatures and NPCs or cooperative AI is actually rather fascinating. You'll find yourself stuck in situations where you'll need to fend off against groups of different creatures but luckily with the hand of some helpful army guys. There are soooo many cool ways things can go from good to bad for you and your team, and although the game itself is pretty simplistic, it's pretty cool watching your AI buddies fending off the best they can.   The atmosphere also has nothing to hide. The scenery is gorgeous, but never fully sustained. The opening areas feel repetitious and so does most of the other factors of the game. Once again, this is why this game had a lot of potential. The areas that this game presents strongly and without flaws deem this game something worthwhile, but unfortunately many of the minor details of this game just force it to fall short. Allow me to venture into the negatives now.  Okay, so there's quite a number of things about this game which sour the experience and ultimately weaken the game's value. These flaws are numerous yet tolerable which is why I assume many people thought this was an enjoyable game. The flaws spread around the repetitive feel of this game. This game has a low variety of weaponry and beasties to fight. There are very few soundtracks in this game and sadly, the fighting experience is very unsatisfying. Fighting werewolves is perhaps the most satisfying feel to this game because in order to kill it you need to land a headshot which feels great to deliver, but it's not too challenging since the werewolf becomes immobile upon taking too many shots. So, all you literally need to do is walk up to it, shoot it in the head, and yay-you killed it. Rinse and repeat. Again. And again. And again. Oh! Maybe with a different gun! Rinse and repeat.  There's only about four or five weapons in the game with less than ten monsters to fight. Now, yes, I understand that the game is short, but you feel the drag occur vividly. About half of the monsters (especially the griffon and minotaurs) feel spongy and only reward you with what you lost while trying to fight them. You see, when you kill monsters in the game, you're given Animus energy. This is the power which you're given upon activating Pandoras' Box in the beginning of the game. You can use Animus energy to either repel monsters or heal yourself. Now, repelling enemies takes a lot of Animus and doesn't harm them, it just pushes them away. So I can already guarantee you'll only be healing yourself with Animus more than anything. So, ask yourself. WHY WOULD I FIGHT MONSTERS, HEAL THE DAMAGE I TOOK, THEN TAKE THEIR ENERGY JUST TO REPEAT THE SAME PROCEDURE?  What? You think there's more to the game? NOPE. There is NOTHING ELSE. Shoot. Heal. Steal Animus. Rinse. Then ♥♥♥♥ing repeat. *takes a deep breath* Okay, I'd like to also note that it gets worse. Since only the creatures reward you with Animus, human enemies do not. And, sadly, human opponents are probably more infuriating to deal with. They deal a lot of damage, work well in groups, and have access to throwables. So you're probably wondering: "Well how do I heal, especially if I reach a checkpoint?" Heh. Get to cover and conserve your Animus wisely, bud. That's your only option. There are no medkits, no salves, no bandages, no nothin'. You're gonna have to tough it out.   Oh, and now I'd like to mention the throwables. You're only given two throwables in the game: molotovs and grenades. Molotovs cover a very small radius and last maybe two or three seconds. Grenades are more useful but since you'll mainly be using them against human opponents, they're practically useless. Molotovs should only be used against blood spiders which aren't introduced until you get halfway through the game...  Hmm... I feel as though I've covered many of the negatives, but I could ramble all day. I apologize for jumping all over the place in this review guys but honestly, I just hate the fact that I can't enjoy this game, This was a title which I had a lot of faith in. Despite the droning music, bullet-absorbing masses of baddies, frustrating AI, boring plot, and every other little piece of crap smudged together, there might be some type of gem hidden beneath the rubble. Do I think it's worth the few bucks? Sure. Just don't expect a miracle.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 13, 2014
												Ok, I figured "<$1, gotta be worth something, right?" Well, if I had tried it 10 years ago I might have been satisfied with this purchase. The thing is, the game came out in 2008. I personally didn't finish the game, and more than likely won't ever do so, especially since my library is already backlogged so heavily, so please take all of this with a grain of salt. Anyway, let me explain the issues:-Graphics are barely passable as an early Xbox 360 game, even at the maximum settings-Animations are laughably bad, both on the human and creature models-The environments have little to no way of telling you what to do next or where to go. Granted, it usually can be figured out pretty quickly since the player can only jump a maximum of 5 cm, usually only leaving one possible path.-Werewolves have a cool mechanic where you have to decapitate them to kill them otherwise they regenerate. Wish the same could be said for other enemies. The developer must have realized this too, and decided to make the werewolf the enemy you face (besides other humans, who also for some reason want to kill you for opening the box) at least 90% of the time-Subways and indoor areas were entirely overused, which is a shame, as the opening outdoor sequence was pretty cool, even though it didn't wow in the graphics department.-Why is literally everyone covered in blood?! Seriously, damn near every character in the opening sequence is covered head to toe in blood. A nitpick, but it bugged me.-Physics based objects, when they do appear, are super wonky. This also extends to the ragdoll effects.-Controls arent terrible, but definitely could have been much more refined. The aim down sights could probably have been excluded and I wouldn't have complained in the slightest.-Voice acting is wooden, the story is not the slightest bit coherent, other than the main concept introduced in the first few minutesPros:-Cool opening city destruction scene-Liked the general look of some enemies-The concept was what actually pushed me to buy the game. You open Pandora's Box, a bunch of scary monsters and♥♥♥♥♥♥come out and wreck everything and you gotta go kill em all and save the city.Remember, I did not finish the game, so don't completely disregard this if it is in fact on sale. Hoever, as I pointed out in my review, the game suffers more than just a bad story and bad visuals. It was simply not fun to play.3/10 regret purchasing

												The foremost factor in a game's rating is enjoyment -- is it enjoyable, and to what degree?  Secondary is value -- price-to-enjoyment ratio.  For a dated title "LEGENDARY" rates well in both.  Being priced under a dollar there is little reason for fans of First-Person Shooter games to hesitate in purchasing this. content:
Posted: February 17, 2016
												I think this game rightfully gets in the mixed ratings category, but please don't skip this game simply because not everyone said it was good.It is a very standard FPS, but the mythological enemies really do sell it for me. How many FPS games do you get to lob a molatov cocktail at a werewolf and fire rockets at griffons? And the other legendary monsters are all very unique and fun to fight.The story is kinda basic too and the characters are a bit bland (you play as a silent protagonist for crying out loud) but I didn't pay the small price tag to get great literary characters (but I admit it would be awesome if I had). Actually it's probably better that the protagonist is silent, it keeps it from making him "edgy" like all the current heroes need to be.And it is a small price tag, but it is a short game: 7 hours for me on hard.I'd just say that I really enjoyed it and would probably play it again just because of the enemies. They really are fun to fight and even just to get scared of when you realize a werewolf is right behind you. The set pieces are fun too from the odd little boss fights to the tracking down a device to open the next door to just stopping and taking in the craziness of what's going on where you are.One more thing: I didn't really have the best computer to render graphics for this game. It was like playing an alpha build for it. And even when the werewolves, floor, and walls didn't have textures on them I still was having a blast. I know some people would have a problem with that if their computer isn't good enough though.It's not Halo, it's not Half-life (although I see some similarities), but it doesn't have to be. It's unique. High recommendations.

content:
Posted: February 15, 2016
												Legendary is a pretty good first-person shooter full of intense action. I wasn't really expecting much, but it turned out to be a good buy. The story is nothing special, the game's rather linear and you can't backtrack, but that doesn't really bother me. The action is great and there's lots of it. Some of the enemies are really tough, but man do you feel like Rambo mowing down everyone with a machine gun.One thing that bothers me is that switching weapons doesn't seem to have any logic (I guess it changes depending on which one you picked up last), and I always choose the wrong weapon first, which is annoying in the middle of action. And even though the game is linear, there are still some "where do I go, what do I do" moments, and the rapidly spawning enemies don't help. But most of the time the game works well and is really fun. If you like Half-Life style action, you could check this out.+ Full of intense action+ Good weapons+ Interesting enemies+ Solid graphics and music (though nothing special)+ Challenging but fun~ Linear, can't backtrack (doesn't really bother me)- Weapon switching is confusing- The mouse is not very precise when aiming with sights or scope4/5

This is a game with typical shooter gameplay that ignores plot plausability and coherence in order to present an action packed world of monsters and wonky rag-doll physics. I laughed out loud at one point because of mass rag-doll physics. I played it for thee werewolfs which are the games most common enemy and one of the few things the game does well. The alpha werewolf is wht a werewolf should be. The Nari have no sense of self-preservation. The kraken should not be able to fit in a river. What the heck are echidna tentacles, All the enmy soldiers reminded of captain hook when I first saw them. Buy this game for a dollar, play it until you've seen the kraken, and then be done with it.

content:
Posted: March 14, 2016
												An okay game in my books. A little annoyed at the game-breaking bug in the elevator at the end. Don't know why or how that exists. Other than that, the game is fine. Graphics and fps are really good considering this game is little over seven years old now. Kind of wish they would make a sequel with less linear gameplay and a lot more types of creature enemies. That is my one complaint: I feel the creature enemy variety is a little lacking. I mean...you can only chuck so many werewolves, firedrakes, minotaurs, griffons, and nari at the player before they say "okay, what else you got?". Granted, the big enemies do mix it up just a little. Releasing the Kraken and spawning a junk golem are about the only true bosses in the game. The rest of them like the alpha werewolves, minotaurs, and griffons feel like nothing but minibosses. And when you get the rocket laucher? Forget it. Even the most stubborn griffon is a one-hit killshot. If I was going to design a sequel to this game, I'd have stuff like vampires, basilisk dragons, harpies, hydras, weretigers, wyverns, and other creatures of mythology in there with all the baddies from this game to mix up the combat. All in all, a good game that I think its good to play through at least a few times. Not the best game ever, but definitely worth playing.

												Alright, finally picked this up on sale for about three quesrters.Even with me dieing a couple of times here and there and that silly elevator glitch towards the end. It only took me approximately 4.9 hours to complete it.The story was unique, i personally liked the modern era with the mythical creatures, etc. There are only a few weapons in game and you can only carry two at a time. I found myself running around with the rocket launcher whenever i was able to get my hands on it just to handle the gryphins from time to time :)The graphics are dated compared to modern times but still stand apart and there are noticible bugs, such as you cant jump and move forward over a obstacle you have to run then jump far away not to get stuck. Lets not forget the final level elevator glitch, I fell through that sucker about four times before i searched for a solution. It didnt ruin my play experience but i did find it tedious.For as short as it was I enjoyed it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 4, 2013
												I was pleasantly suprised by Legendary. I wasn't expecting much at all, but it was fun.  Now the game could've used some more polish. Fighting the Judge Dredds wasn't all that good, but still ok. Aiming with rifles was less than accurate. The atmosphere of the game was really good. It's the kind of game that demands to be played late at night with the lights out and headphones on. There's lots of crazy chaos with monsters terrorizing the planet. Traversing dark sewers always looking around for the creepy flying demons that giggle like little children and the sea creatures trying to pull you in with their tentacles was one of my favorite parts. There's a decent variety of supernatural monsters to fight and locations in the game. There are significant portions of the game where I felt just fine using only an axe. Chopping off were-wolf heads so they don't come back to life never got tiring. The game took around 6 hours to finish. The regular price is $5 and you simply can't go wrong for that price. It's not the greatest game ever, but I definitely recommend Legendary. It's good times.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 23, 2016
												This game is Legandary... If we're talking about simplistic, and slow. You wont find much to differ this game from other shooters besides the painstakingly broken healing, and easy enemies. If you're not being 1 hit killed by some random annoying thing, it's the pace killing puzzle sequences, like some kind of poor-man's Half-Life 2. Often does this game feel as if it doesn't know exactly what it is... Are you a shooter?, dark fantasy set with greek mythological themes?, or a plot driven set-piece affair? I really wish I could love this game; but that appears to be impossible at this point.Towards the beginning I was struggling with only a pistol vs enemies with no discernible weak point. Enemies that spit fire at you from all directions. This was not so bad as it felt challenging... That was until I learned how to heal. From then on, I haven't died a single time to a normal enemy. Only the cheap kills sometimes manage to get me; but beyond that, there were no struggles exhibited from fighting any of the normal enemies. The AI is not so bad; but the healing factor is just too good in this game. You then reach the later levels of the game, where it suddenly ramps up the difficulty, artificially. The enemies are not more difficult, they just start to spawn in certain places infinitely. It Serves to waste ammo and create tedium, as enemies do not give you even a second to think about your surroundings. The game legitimately tries to have you solve problems while facing off with a never ending onslaught of Werewolves, and Exploding Spiders. This wouldn't be so annoying if you didn't move around like you had a weight strapped to your ankle. The Main Protagonist can neither jump high enough, or move fast enough to evade enemies for very long. It serves to note that his impressive run-jump can't be used in any other direction but forward. Jumping is the same as dodging in a first person shooter, and with this mechanic so severely crippled, it just made it easier to get infuriated as I tapped the force push mechanic. The force push becomes even more important late game; but they were smart to make this ability also require the power you use to heal, to use it. You'd have 3 or 4 chances at the push move before it was depleted, and enemies are pretty relentless about charging you. The great thing is, you can't use any ability while you reload, which lead to some rather frustrating deaths in heated combat. The limitations, and player limitations totally handicap you into becoming nothing but a walking turret. I've played Wolenstein 3D many times, and love the game; but this game spits on it's legacy with how embarassingly bad it is. It is true that you don't need to be able to jump, or have super quick movement; but you just feel gimped in the face of all the enemies in this game.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 14, 2016
												An okay game in my books. A little annoyed at the game-breaking bug in the elevator at the end. Don't know why or how that exists. Other than that, the game is fine. Graphics and fps are really good considering this game is little over seven years old now. Kind of wish they would make a sequel with less linear gameplay and a lot more types of creature enemies. That is my one complaint: I feel the creature enemy variety is a little lacking. I mean...you can only chuck so many werewolves, firedrakes, minotaurs, griffons, and nari at the player before they say "okay, what else you got?". Granted, the big enemies do mix it up just a little. Releasing the Kraken and spawning a junk golem are about the only true bosses in the game. The rest of them like the alpha werewolves, minotaurs, and griffons feel like nothing but minibosses. And when you get the rocket laucher? Forget it. Even the most stubborn griffon is a one-hit killshot. If I was going to design a sequel to this game, I'd have stuff like vampires, basilisk dragons, harpies, hydras, weretigers, wyverns, and other creatures of mythology in there with all the baddies from this game to mix up the combat. All in all, a good game that I think its good to play through at least a few times. Not the best game ever, but definitely worth playing.

content:
Posted: June 29, 2015
												So, as someone who REALLY wanted this game and was super hyped for it back when it was first announced but chose not to get it after the horrible reviews, here's my review after finally picking this game up.Overall, I'd say it's a pretty good little game.  I definitely wouldn't have paid full price for it at launch now that I've seen it myself, but for the current price on Steam?  Definitely worth it.Pros:-Interesting enemies.  Werewolves and griffons in New York?  As cool now as it was back when this game came out.-Destructible terrain.  I've had enemies blow up bits of walls that I had no idea they could blow up so they could shoot me in the face.  There's a surprising amount of stuff that can be blasted apart to get at the enemy, and I really think this game could have done a little better if they had pushed this point a little harder.Cons:-Endless enemies.  Some areas the enemies just keep spawning and attacking you until you perform a certain action, other areas you simply can't advance until you've killed enough enemies.  The fights where you have to kill a number of enemies tend to drag on, so it gets hard to tell which type of fight you're involved in.-Poor AI.  This is one of the killing points for this game after having the team hype up how advanced it would be.  I've seen enemies run circles around other enemies because the other guy was sitting where they wanted to sit.  And don't get me started on the number of times guys with shotguns thought they could peg me from the other side of a battlefield.-Buggy.  Quite buggy.  Loading from a checkpoint seems to respawn ALL enemies, even ones that you killed before reaching the checkpoint, and there's a fatal bug right before the final battle that you'll need to edit the game files to get around.-Story/writing.  Okay, I normally avoid bringing writing up, but when a guy comments about how he shouldn't be poking the mysterious puss sack only to start poking it again I'm going to complain.The game costs like $3 on Steam.  It's worth the price for a few hours of silly monster-mashing fun.  I admit I haven't beaten the game (I'm of the opinion that the final battle is just extremely poorly designed) but I absolutely have no regrets buying it.  The game probably would have done better in it's day if it had a lower price and wasn't hyped as much as it was, but as it's got neither the hype nor the price these days there's no reason not to check it out.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 22, 2015
												This game is worth $5... no more... no less.5 hours of game play.50 minutes of headaches.5 minutes of bad cut scenes5 mins of editing INI files.50 secounds of fun with the flamethrower.This isn't a bad game. It's not a good game. It's a game. Interesting plot/story in so far as the mythology is concerned. TERRIBLE voice acting. Truly the actors either didn't care or were directed badly. Either way it's not good.The save check point is annoying but not terrible since it saves your weapons and reloads all your ammo.The power yes... one. Could have been interested or at least had upgrades but no...All in all it's a fun distraction and if you're looking for an average FPS where you are the Hero and saviour of mankind then yes this game is for you.One thing though... there is a nasty clipping bug for the final level where you fall through the last elevator... horrifying that this wasn't addressed by the developer.No patch just some advice involving INI files.Here is the solution that worked for me. Best of luck fellow gamer.Here is a fix that works for most people.Open the PandoraEngine.ini (on vista it is on C:\Users\USERNAME\Documents\My Games\Legendary\PandoraGame\Config-Folder) and search for"MaxSmoothedFrameRate=300" and change the value to 60. So the game runs at maximum 60 fps. Play through to next check point save then edit it back to 300 and continue game.If a setting of 60 does not work try 30.Game will not run so good but it's only a short run to the next checkpoint where you can then reset back to 300 and trust me you will want to.GG.
